title: Canada’s new superiority complex shattered by cursory glance at CBC comments section - The Beaverton
text: OTTAWA — In a crushing blow to its upcoming 150th anniversary celebrations, Canada’s emerging sense of comparative superiority to the United States was shattered this week, following a casual look at the comments section of literally any CBC article.

title: Andrew Scheer pepper sprayed while trying to photobomb wedding - The Beaverton
text: OTTAWA – Mere moments after a mischievous smile spread across his face at the sight of a young couple taking wedding photos, a shirtless Andrew Scheer is rolling on the ground, grovelling and squealing in anguish.

title: This year’s most popular Father’s Day gift just box full of gears and wires - The Beaverton
text: CANADA – Businesses across the nation are reporting that this year’s most popular Father’s Day gift is a nondescript cardboard box filled with gears and wires of various sizes that retails for $29.95.

title: MMIW commission insist they are very close to figuring out how office telephones work - The Beaverton
text: OTTAWA – After several months and over five million dollars spent the commissioners tasked with investigating the tragedy of missing and murdered indigenous women have assured Canadians they are almost done setting up their telecommunications system.

title: Amazing! Meet the vigilante garbage man who goes after the trash the city won’t touch! - The Beaverton
text: In the city of Toronto, it’s estimated that only about 50% of waste is disposed of properly. It is believed this is mainly due to some of it being too hard to reach or too high profile to take out publicly.

title: National Post columnist retires to spend more time being snide with his family - The Beaverton
text: TORONTO – After a long, fulfilling career as a screed-writer for one of Canada’s newspapers of note, columnist Eustace Tibbs has retired to spend more time disparaging his children.

title: Man wins Facebook argument by being last to post in thread - The Beaverton
text: AURORA, ON – A local man is declaring victory after being the last person to post in a heated debate on a news story post to Facebook.

title: Family raises stolen pint glass to honour man who taught them how to not look drunk - The Beaverton
text: OTTAWA – The children of the Cartwright family are raising a stolen pint glass this father’s day, to celebrate the man who taught them how to look not drunk.

title: Toronto's Trump Hotel renamed the James Comey Resort & Spa - The Beaverton
text: TORONTO – In an effort to distance themselves from the controversy surrounding President Donald Trump, the owners of the Trump International Hotel & Tower located at Bay & Adelaide in Toronto have elected to change the name to the James Comey Resort & Spa.

TTC plans radical initiative to improve weekend subway service with use of trains - The Beaverton
text: TORONTO – At a press conference held at Kennedy Station, TTC CEO Andy Byford announced a bold new strategy to improve weekend subway service by using actual trains instead of buses.

title: City of Toronto announces street closures for Festival of Street Closures - The Beaverton
text: TORONTO – As the 171st annual Festival of Street Closures approaches, the city has released a list of roads that will be inaccessible for the duration of the festival, and also for the rest of the summer due to construction.

title: Montreal celebrates 50th anniversary of 325th anniversary celebrations - The Beaverton
text: MONTREAL – Celebrations have already started for Montreal’s 50th anniversary of the 325th birthday celebrations since the city was first colonized by Europeans.

title: Quebec apologizes to citizens still trapped by 1998 ice storm - The Beaverton
text: MONTREAL — A spokesperson for the governments of Montreal and the province of Quebec released official apologies, Sunday, to those still affected by recent weather disturbances, specifically the 1998 ice storm.

title: Marionette festival showcases this year's top nightmares - The Beaverton
text: MONTREAL — The 12th annual Puppet Theatre Festival (Festival des Casteliers) has arrived in Montreal to publicly showcase your most deep-seated fears.

title: Guide To: Montreal - The Beaverton
Christy Clark and John Horgan agree to joint custody of British Columbia - The Beaverton
text:
VANCOUVER – Following weeks of political uncertainty in British Columbia, with no party winning a majority of seats in its most recent provincial election, Liberal leader Christy Clark and NDP leader John Horgan have finally agreed to joint custody of the province.

“Christy will get the province from Monday to Thursday, and John gets Fridays and the weekend,” said presiding judge Fiona Delaunay after a brutal six-hour hearing. “For Christmas you’ll swap every other year.”

Horgan was originally meant to take full custody of the province, with the backing of Andrew Weaver’s BC Greens, but Clark disputed the decision after deciding that she “wasn’t comfortable with only having visiting rights.”

“I don’t trust John to see after BC’s needs,” said Clark. “The province, and especially the government, are used to a certain standard of living and John simply can’t pull in those kinds of donations on his own. Do you think someone who only won 41 seats can really be a provider?”

Horgan has vehemently disagreed with the ruling, and was furious when Clark claimed that the province would “become confused” by him always having Weaver over, but has accepted it and plans to spend the next few weeks buttering BC up.

“We’re going to have some fun weekends, just me and little ole’ British Columbia,” said Horgan, sipping coffee from a prematurely purchased “World’s Greatest Premier” mug. “We’ll go on nature walks, get some ice cream, and I’ll throw in some subtle jabs about how Christy pays so little in support because she doesn’t love the province.”

Barring any changes in the agreement, BC will continue to reside with both Clark and Horgan until it turns 150 and can legally decide on its own who it wants to stay with.

title: White smoke billows from BC pot shops indicating a new government has been chosen - The Beaverton
text: VANCOUVER – After nearly three weeks of waiting, white smoke has appeared from the many BC medical marijuana dispensaries indicating that a new Premier has been chosen.

title: Tourists line up to offer their children to famous local sea lion - The Beaverton
text: RICHMOND, BC – Hundreds of tourists at Steveston Fisherman’s Wharf offered up their small children to the famous sea lion who performed an impressive grab of a small child on Saturday.

title: Used Vancouver ballot box now acting as a bachelor pad for $1700/month plus utilities - The Beaverton
text: VANCOUVER – An empty ballot box for the provincial riding of Vancouver-Langara is now being offered as a bachelor pad for $1,700 per month plus utilities.

title: Yukoners generously sever toes to replace stolen one from Dawson City bar - The Beaverton
text: DAWSON CITY, YT – In what many are describing as a grotesque act of kindness, hundreds of Yukoners have severed and donated their toes to replace the mummified digit that was stolen by a customer a few days ago.

title: Local family inadvertently drives across Yukon for entire weekend in search of elusive vacant campsite - The Beaverton
text: WHITEHORSE – A Whitehorse family has inadvertently driven 3,700 km across most of the Yukon last weekend searching for a single, vacant campsite without success.

title: Trump announces tariffs on earthquakes originating from Canada - The Beaverton

title: REPORT: Jordan Peterson using Patreon money to defend free speech from atop new yacht - The Beaverton
text: TORONTO – This week controversial University of Toronto professor Jordan Peterson assured supporters that their Patreon donations will be used in his continuing crusade against political correctness, and has unrelatedly placed the down payment on a 40-foot yacht.

title: University student working menial summer job unaware it will be permanent job after graduation - The Beaverton
text: WINDSOR – A third year University of Windsor student working at a menial job for the summer months is unaware that after she graduates, she will return to the position permanently.

title: University revolutionary pretty sure intelligentsia won’t get purged this time - The Beaverton
text: TORONTO – Two years into his undergraduate degree, local student Sam Taylor is convinced he won’t be one of the ones put up against the wall when the revolution comes.

title: Sun newspapers still reporting Harper majority - The Beaverton
text: Despite the results being posted two days ago, Sun newspaper outlets have steadfastly denied the existence of a Liberal majority government and have continued to assume Conservative leader Stephen Harper will carry on his mandate as Prime Minister.

text: WINNIPEG – For the first time in his long life, habitual abstainer Jack Pilman will cast a ballot in a Canadian election, throwing his support behind the Social Credit party.

text: TORONTO – In a last minute gamble for GTA seats, the Conservative Party unveiled a new attack ad over the weekend suggesting Liberal leader Justin Trudeau wanted the Kansas City Royals to defeat the Toronto Blue Jays in the ALCS.

title: World leaders divided on attending state funeral for Hawaiian pizza inventor - The Beaverton
text: LONDON, ON – World leaders are already divided on whether they will be attending the state funeral on Monday for the controversial Canadian man who invented the Hawaiian pizza.

title: Theresa May forms coalition with Northern Irish Unionists after agreeing to re-invade the rest of Ireland - The Beaverton
text: LONDON – British Prime Minister Theresa May has secured a coalition government deal with the Democratic Unionist Party of Northern Ireland after promising to re-occupy the Irish Republic.

title: Jealous Macron angrily refreshing Trudeau-Obama coverage every five seconds - The Beaverton
text: PARIS — The so-called “bromance” between former US President Barack Obama and Canadian Justin Trudeau has once again captured the world’s imagination, according to French president Emmanuel Macron, whom staffers say has been angrily refreshing coverage of the encounter every five seconds since yesterday.

title: Canadian tourist causes chaos after replying "I'm good" to yes or no question - The Beaverton
text: CAPE TOWN, SA – A Canadian visiting South Africa has caused chaos by giving a polite, yet vague, non-answer to a question asked by a server at a local restaurant.

title: Megyn Kelly, NBC to provide “much needed platform” to Holocaust deniers - The Beaverton
text: NEW YORK — After using the first two episodes of her nationally broadcast, Sunday night news magazine as a soapbox for scrappy underdogs Vladimir Putin and Alex Jones, Megyn Kelly and NBC News announced this week plans to provide a much needed platform for the most marginalized of all American voices, Holocaust deniers.

title: Trump pulls out of climate change agreement in hopes climate will cave, give better deal - The Beaverton
text: WASHINGTON D.C. — President Donald Trump has announced that America will be withdrawing from the Paris Accord on Climate Change, a move which his administration says will force the climate to agree to U.S. terms.

title: Entire G7 waits for Trump to leave so they can start real summit - The Beaverton
text: SICILY – After two days of shuffling blank papers and waving shiny objects, heads of state from G7 countries have begun preparing for the actual summit scheduled to commence after Donald Trump’s Saturday evening departure.

title: Uber CEO replaced by sleep-deprived foreign student who really needs the cash - The Beaverton
text: SAN FRANCISCO – After months of upheaval within the company, Travis Kalanick has stepped down as the CEO of Uber and will be replaced by a tired foreign student who has to pick up a few extra hours if he’s going to make rent this month.

title: Amazon acquires Whole Foods in bid to corner market on privileged white people - The Beaverton
text: SEATTLE — Online retailing giant Amazon (TSX: AMZN-Q)  announced this week plans to acquire supermarket chain Whole Foods (TSX: WFM-Q) in what company spokesman Larry Wilson acknowledged is an attempt to corner the global market on upper-middle class white people.

title: Sears Canada renames itself ‘Bombardier’ so government will bail it out of bankruptcy - The Beaverton

title: WestJet realizes it can expand its business by also flying east - The Beaverton

title: Old racist thinks racist kids have it too easy these days - The Beaverton
text: Chatham, ON – Local pharmacist and long-time white supremacist Alex Robichaud has had it with the Southern Ontario alt-right community, declaring that young racists today have it “way too easy”.

title: Local dog spends weekend on couch binge-licking - The Beaverton
text: KAMLOOPS – This past weekend saw Barkley, a Chocolate Labrador, spend nearly all of his waking hours on the couch, seemingly unable to stop cleaning his genitals with his tongue.
